title: Veigar is actually well balanced now
body: Landing his stun vs bots is easy since they run in a straight line back to base so you should be able to stomp bots. Win vs bots, collect ip, buy any other champion and then play and win vs real opponents

replies.body: Sweet, now I can use my $15 skin while I roflstomp bots. Thank you based Riot!

IM literally changing games because im so sick of riot fucking changes not making any sense, there was nothing wrong with veigar - there was SO MANY champs that needed nerfing and they just royally screw him over.

I'm not sure you've ever actually played Veigar.... He's always had one of the WORST lane phases... He does so LITTLE dmg in early game and you spend a lot of mana farming your Q's... now you can farm 2 minions at a time w/ his Q's.

Personally... if you can get used to his new Q's.. it sounds like he's stronger in late game now.  It just seems like it takes a little more skill to earn it since you have to land skill shots... 

My advice.. stop missing your Q's.

-Edit-  Yea... I forgot to mention the change to his stun... yea.. oh darn.. it takes .75 to pop the wall up.. oh well... it's still a pretty awesome cage of "DON'T GO THERE!!"  It's still pretty inconvenient to deal with in team fights if your team isn't the one Veigar's on...

Play against Zed, LB, Akali, etc.. and enjoy being turretdive with nothing you can do about it thanks to the new stun. Or you end up getting camped by junglers like Vi, Lee, Jarvan who can easilly turret dive you. have fun
Not sure why you'd pick Veigar vs one of them in the first place... lmao

If you main someone, you're willing to play them against the odds because it can only make you better and it less of a harsh counter.

Also sometimes you go into blind pick, or you draft first and nobody wants to trade you.

This season I've been maining Aatrox or Malphite as his replacement. They both have a ton of counters, but I've gotten significantly better and handling their weaknesses. It would help the fact if they suddenly just received changes that made it harder to handle.
Because with skill you can still win. They are hard, sure, but Veigar had a chance.  Now, no dice b/c of the useless stun.
he could hold his own before.  it wasnt easy to hit a champ who has just used a gap closer with the edge of the ring and stun, but it was possible.  now you just die.

You have to actually do a skillshot to use that stun. Veigar's cheap forcing of the edge was not hard to do at all.
It was harder than putting your mouse on top of the opponent and pressing a key... Which is all Sona has to do.

Straight line shots are very easy for (skilled) enemies to dodge. It's called ducking and weaving. You have to account for that. It's difficult. Unlike when you're dealing with a big ol' circle and "lemme put this line on that hero there, PRESTO" then click and stun.

It required more skill for the Veigar player than the Sona player. The actual process of aiming required more thought and precision. That's not to say that Veigar's stun as it was before was balanced. I'm saying nothing more than that Veigar's stun was and is more difficult to use than most. With practice it became second nature, yes, but don't discount that practice time and compare it to something as simple as Sona's ult.

Don't bother, they're either a troll or a moron, and either way are not worth your time.

I've played Veigar and Sona, and I have to say that landing her stun is so much easier than Veig's.  Didn't play him for a while, then jumped into a Team Builder match, and I missed 1/2 of my stuns because I didn't account enough for enemy movement and they slipped right through before the wall appeared.  People just assume it's easy to land because they get instastunned so often, which like you said, takes practice and knowledge to consistently pull off.
When I was a new user I wanted every champ that did good against my favorite champs to get massively gutted.  I assume that it's the same for you.

There are already posts on this forum of diamond players saying Veigar is fine. You can still stun people, but you can't force the edge of the gate on them. Forcing the edge of the gate on them is the OPTIMAL gameplay.  Without this, your enemy is free to kill you.  I played the new veigar on PBE, and NO ONE that isn't a total dumbass will walk into the wall.  It's just not happening.  And while they increased the range, if the enemy is not directly in the center of the cage, they have the movespeed to walk right out of it.  By moving. In a STRAIGHT LINE.

You cannot tell me that the intended gameplay is for your opponent to mess up horribly in order to do anything.  That goes against pretty much all logic in a competitive game.  You won't hit anyone above gold with this. Ever. Unless they happen to have 300 ping, in which case, it's just as balanced as before.

Getting the enemy directly in the center of the cage is how you are supposed to aim it. They can't kill you if they are trapped in the cage and you are at a safe distance. Now you can attempt to use your W or call an ally for help. What is the problem?

Keywords there:  "If you are at a safe distance."

Veigar's ult range is not "at a safe distance."

You're saying, "Ok, I've successfully trapped someone in my cage.  But they're not stunned, so they'll just kill me if I get close.  Better just run away from my SUCCESSFULLY TRAPPED ENEMY!"

If you're expecting to get an instant stun with E followed by an instant kill with W, then you need to get rid of this notion from your brain-space. This is not going to happen in LoL anymore, because it's simply not fair. You can say "strategy though you dont let veigar get close to you!!" but guess what: game ain't balanced that way anymore. Strategy is not as important as guaranteeing that every kill a hero gets has been obtained through skill and aiming. Veigar represents everything that is wrong with this game.
